placesToVisit.description: An iconic symbol of Paris, offering breathtaking views of the city from its observation decks.
Home to thousands of works of art, including the Mona Lisa and the Venus de Milo.
A masterpiece of French Gothic architecture, with stunning stained glass windows and intricate sculptures.
The largest amphitheater ever built, a testament to the power and engineering of the Roman Empire.
The heart of ancient Rome, with ruins of temples, basilicas, and public spaces.
The smallest independent state in the world, home to St. Peter's Basilica and the Vatican Museums.
A historic castle that has served as a royal palace, prison, and treasury.
The official residence of the Queen, where you can watch the famous Changing of the Guard ceremony.
A vast collection of world art and artifacts, including the Rosetta Stone and the Elgin Marbles.
An iconic symbol of Berlin and a reminder of the city's tumultuous history.
The seat of the German parliament, with a modern glass dome offering panoramic views of the city.
The longest remaining section of the Berlin Wall, now an open-air gallery with murals by artists from all over the world.
The house where Anne Frank and her family hid from the Nazis during World War II.
The national museum of the Netherlands, with a vast collection of Dutch art and history.
The largest collection of works by Vincent van Gogh in the world.
